tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Similarly, there is an invisible aspect of the present, outward world and it is the world of the Hereafter. At the time of the advent of Islam, there were two very great empires in the world —the Christian Roman Empire and the Zoroastrian Persian Empire
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Ar-Rum, Ayah 6?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In the present world, God has scattered His signs everywhere—in the human environment, in the surrounding universe and also in the teachings of the Prophet
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: If one accepts the present world, but does not accept the Hereafter, it amounts to denying a natural corollary of a fact which one has oneself accepted as such
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The fact is that if a man gives deep consideration to God’s creations, he will feel that the presence of God is reflected in everything. A wonderful miracle of the present world is growth and development
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Ar-Rum, Ayah 22?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: But these signs are only for those who lend their ears to the silent call of the Universe—for those who put their wisdom and their knowledge to the correct use
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In the light of the feat of the first creation, which is being performed in the universe at every moment, to accept the possibility of the second creation is just like accepting a proven fact
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse narrates a historical event

tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Ar-Rum, Ayah 28?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: God alone is the Lord of the entire Universe. The relation between God and His creatures is the same as that between master and servant on a larger scale, and not that of sharers of a property
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Ar-Rum, Ayah 30?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: This is the religion of nature and it eternally pervades the inner soul of man. This results from the additions made by later generations to the original teachings of Prophets
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: This is the psychological proof of the Oneness of God. Under ordinary circumstances man finds himself possessed of certain powers
distractors: This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse narrates a historical event
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: One sign of a believer is that he spends his wealth for the pleasure of God. He spends his wealth to reap the benefits of the Hereafter and not to earn profits in this world like a usurer
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Ar-Rum, Ayah 40?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: If human beings adopt the one God as their object of worship, then everyone’s centre of attention is one. On the contrary, if numerous entities are made objects of worship, and people individually worship different things, their attention becomes divided
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Man deviated from God’s scheme and completely ignored His creation plan, in that he single-mindedly pursued worldly comforts. Scientists now believe that the modern industrial age spells total catastrophe and that the world is careering head on to its doom
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: On that day, God’s reward will be bestowed upon those who lived in this world entirely as men of God, and those whose interests were linked to any beings other than God will be eternally deprived of God’s blessings
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Ar-Rum, Ayah 46?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: All these arrangements have been made with a view to ensuring that man lives in the world as a grateful subject of God. The blowing of a cool breeze before the start of the rains announces the fact that the God of this world is the most Kind and Merciful
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: When a man treads the path of Truth, he has frequently to face great difficulties, as happened with the Prophet and his companions in the early days. Naturally, He will certainly help those who tread His path
distractors: This verse narrates a historical event
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the main message of Surah Ar-Rum, Ayah 54?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In the life of this world, man cares nothing for the Hereafter, because the Day of Judgement appears to be very far away. When the Day of Judgement arrives, —the stage for the next world—he will feel as if he had lived in the previous world for only a moment
distractors: This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only
This verse describes the creation of mankind

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Ar-Rum, Ayah 58?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The dayee talks exclusively of the Hereafter, while people’s minds are engaged in solving worldly problems. One’s heart being sealed means one’s not being capable of understanding things due to ignorance and wrong thinking
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
